meanings.sent1: The chuff cat refused to play with the new toy.
meanings.sent2: She had a chuff expression when her ice cream fell on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The chuff puppy kept barking at its own reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: His chuff mood was like a dark cloud hanging over the party.
meanings.sent5: The chuff child crossed their arms and pouted all day.

meanings.definition: A puff or blast of air.
meanings.sent1: The strong chuff of wind blew the leaves off the tree.
meanings.sent2: She felt a gentle chuff on her face as the train passed by.
meanings.sent3: The chuff from the fan made the papers on the desk flutter.
meanings.sent4: The chuff of the steam engine signaled its departure.
meanings.sent5: A sudden chuff of air made the candles flicker.

meanings.sent1: The old car chuffed as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent2: She could hear the train chuffing in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The teapot chuffed happily as it boiled water for tea.
meanings.sent4: The exhausted runner chuffed for breath after the race.
meanings.sent5: The steam engine chuffed rhythmically as it pulled the carriages.
